ARTICLE.TITLE: The Block Star turned concert promoter Phil Rankine faces court
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Reality TV star turned concert promoter Phil Rankine has faced court for the first time on charges of stealing more than $5 million.

Rankine – who, along with then-wife Amity Dry, found fame on The Block in 2003 and later returned for the 2013 “All-Stars” series – appeared in the Adelaide Magistrates Court on Wednesday morning after he was charged in June.

He and Dry split in 2018.

media_camera Phil Rankine leaves court in Adelaide after appearing on theft charges for the first time. Picture: NCA NewsWire/Dean Martin

After his stint on reality TV, the 51-year-old established a career in the music industry. He brought some of the biggest names in the business to South Australia, including Lionel Richie, Bob Dylan, Florence and the Machine and Bon Jovi.

Now, Rankine is charged with 20 counts of dishonestly taking property without consent – four of those charges are aggravated.

A police prosecutor told the court the matter was “complex” and “involves numerous victims”, before asking for an 11-month adjournment to allow preparation of e-crime and forensic evidence.

media_camera Phil Rankine and his former wife Amity Dry won The Block All-Stars. Picture: Calum Robertson

Rankine is accused of stealing more than $5 million from investors both in Australia and internationally across 2018 and 2019.

“It will be alleged the man committed the thefts by obtaining money from the victims which was to be used for various high-profile Adelaide events,” police said in a statement at the time of his arrest.

Magistrate Briony Kennewell continued Rankine’s bail to reappear in July next year.

He made no comment as he left court flanked by lawyers.

Originally published as The Block star accused of stealing $5m

METADATA.description: Phil Rankine  who found fame on The Block with then-wife Amity Dry  had little to say as he appeared in court for the first time.
METADATA.keywords: star Phil Rankine, Phil Rankine XXX, Block star Phil, turned concert promoter, Australia, Australia and New Zealand, Oceania, South Australia, Bob Dylan, Amity Dry, Lionel Richie, Bianca De Marchi, Kathryn Bermingham, Calum Robertson
